intro: Crotalaria cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and often have a hairy texture. The seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, spiny pod, which contributes to its common name.
